text: greetings my name is Matt Wood and I'm
here at the AWS headquarters in Seattle
to talk to you about low balancing with
containers many of you will be familiar
with the ec2 container service that lets
you easily manage Docker containers
across a fleet of ec2 instances the new
application low balancer makes it easier
to run multiple applications on a fleet
of instances by specifying Dynamic ports
in the ECS container task definition
when a new task is added to the fleet
the ECS scheduler automatically adds it
to the application load balancer using
this port the load balancer can also be
shared with multiple ECS services using
path-based routing and this makes it
easier to manage your container-based
applications and more cost effective
since you can stack more application
components onto a single ec2 Fleet this
is available now for the ec2 container
service thanks a lot
